question: Van Gogh was born in Zundert, Netherlands. True or False?
Van Gogh was born on March 30, 1853. True or False?
Van Gogh originally planned to become a pastor before turning to art. True or False?
Van Gogh spent most of his childhood in France. True or False?
Van Gogh had a younger brother named Theo who supported him financially. True or False?
Van Gogh’s earliest major work is 'The Potato Eaters.' True or False?
Van Gogh is most commonly classified as an Impressionist. True or False?
Van Gogh famously cut off a portion of his own ear. True or False?
Van Gogh sold many paintings at high prices during his lifetime. True or False?
Van Gogh died in 1890 from a gunshot wound. True or False?
Van Gogh briefly worked as an art dealer for Goupil & Cie. True or False?
Van Gogh once lived in London while working at an art dealership. True or False?
Van Gogh’s brother Theo died only a few months after Van Gogh. True or False?
Van Gogh was widely recognized and celebrated by the general public during his lifetime. True or False?
Van Gogh completed over 2,000 artworks (paintings and drawings) in total. True or False?
Van Gogh’s painting style is known for delicate pastel tones and subtle shading. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Starry Night' was painted while he was at the asylum in Saint-Rémy. True or False?
Van Gogh’s painting 'The Scream' is one of his best-known works. True or False?
Van Gogh’s father was a Protestant minister. True or False?
Van Gogh’s bold colors and brushwork influenced modern art movements like Expressionism. True or False?
Van Gogh moved to Paris in 1886 to live with Theo. True or False?
Van Gogh shares credit for co-founding the Cubist art movement. True or False?
Van Gogh’s first language was Dutch. True or False?
Van Gogh produced a significant number of self-portraits. True or False?
Van Gogh was well known for using bright, vibrant yellows in his paintings. True or False?
Van Gogh only painted one self-portrait in his entire career. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Café Terrace at Night' is set in Arles, France. True or False?
Van Gogh studied briefly at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Antwerp. True or False?
Van Gogh’s mother was named Anna Carbentus van Gogh. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Wheatfield with Crows' is often considered his last painting. True or False?
Van Gogh was known for applying paint thickly, a technique called impasto. True or False?
Van Gogh’s mental health struggles never led him to stay in an asylum. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Bedroom in Arles' depicts his personal living space in Arles. True or False?
Van Gogh primarily favored the color green above all others in his paintings. True or False?
Van Gogh was influenced by Japanese ukiyo-e prints. True or False?
Van Gogh wrote hundreds of letters to his brother Theo. True or False?
Van Gogh typically signed his paintings simply with 'Vincent.' True or False?
Van Gogh was financially independent and did not rely on his brother’s support. True or False?
Van Gogh once hoped to form an artists’ community in Arles with Paul Gauguin. True or False?
Van Gogh lived from 1853 to 1890. True or False?
Van Gogh died at the age of 70. True or False?
Van Gogh primarily worked in oil paint on canvas. True or False?
Van Gogh painted 'Irises' while staying at the Saint-Rémy asylum. True or False?
Van Gogh devoted most of his career to painting aristocratic families in formal portraits. True or False?
Van Gogh spent time as a missionary in the Borinage region of Belgium before pursuing art full-time. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'The Potato Eaters' depicts peasants sharing a meal in a dimly lit room. True or False?
Van Gogh disliked painting nature scenes and avoided landscapes. True or False?
Van Gogh considered color to be a means of expressing emotion rather than just imitating reality. True or False?
Van Gogh’s brother Theo worked as an art dealer. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Starry Night Over the Rhône' was painted in Amsterdam. True or False?
Van Gogh’s energetic brushstrokes helped pave the way for Expressionism. True or False?
Van Gogh’s father died in 1885, during the period he painted 'The Potato Eaters.' True or False?
Van Gogh spent most of his childhood in The Hague. True or False?
Van Gogh was known to have destroyed all his early drawings before painting. True or False?
Van Gogh’s style is viewed as bridging Impressionism and early Expressionism. True or False?
Van Gogh created his 'Sunflowers' paintings to help decorate a room for Paul Gauguin. True or False?
Van Gogh only started painting seriously around age 27. True or False?
Van Gogh worked primarily in watercolor throughout his entire career. True or False?
Van Gogh sometimes made copies of artworks he admired to practice techniques. True or False?
Van Gogh’s letters to Theo often include detailed thoughts on color theory and composition. True or False?
Van Gogh cut off his entire left ear, not just a portion. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Night Café' depicts an outdoor terrace under a starry sky. True or False?
Van Gogh’s brother Theo married Johanna Bonger, who later promoted Van Gogh’s art. True or False?
Van Gogh rarely used swirling or energetic brushstrokes, preferring precise realism. True or False?
Van Gogh’s mental health diagnosis remains debated, with suggestions including bipolar disorder and epilepsy. True or False?
Van Gogh left no letters or written correspondence behind. True or False?
Van Gogh died in Auvers-sur-Oise, France. True or False?
Van Gogh authored roughly 800–900 letters, many to his brother Theo. True or False?
Van Gogh once tried to donate his paintings to the Catholic Church, but was refused. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Portrait of Dr. Gachet' once sold for a record-breaking price at auction. True or False?
Van Gogh frequently traveled to America to showcase his artwork. True or False?
Van Gogh wrote about being inspired by Japanese art, especially woodblock prints. True or False?
Van Gogh’s artworks are generally categorized as Post-Impressionist. True or False?
Van Gogh believed color could carry deep emotional or symbolic meaning. True or False?
Van Gogh had a close friendship with Paul Gauguin that ended dramatically. True or False?
Van Gogh meticulously avoided using outlines or bold edges in his paintings. True or False?
Van Gogh admitted himself voluntarily into the Saint-Paul-de-Mausole asylum. True or False?
Van Gogh considered 'The Potato Eaters' a failure and destroyed it. True or False?
Van Gogh’s mother, Anna, outlived him. True or False?
Van Gogh employed a strict pointillism technique in almost all his works. True or False?
Van Gogh once described the light in the south of France as more intense than in the north. True or False?
Van Gogh painted 'Starry Night' in Paris overlooking the Seine. True or False?
Van Gogh believed color could be symbolic, not merely realistic. True or False?
Van Gogh’s artistic approach was strongly influenced by Jean-François Millet. True or False?
Van Gogh never painted any flowers besides sunflowers. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Almond Blossom' series was inspired by the birth of his nephew. True or False?
Critics have noted Japanese-influenced outlines in Van Gogh’s bold brushstrokes. True or False?
Van Gogh was physically and mentally healthy throughout his life, with no crises. True or False?
Van Gogh died roughly 30 hours after being shot, not a full two days. True or False?
Van Gogh is buried alongside his brother Theo in Auvers-sur-Oise. True or False?
Van Gogh sometimes used a perspective frame to help with composition. True or False?
Van Gogh gave up painting altogether after his argument with Gauguin. True or False?
Van Gogh occasionally painted over older canvases to economize. True or False?
Van Gogh’s intense use of yellow was influenced by modern digital art software. True or False?
Van Gogh created multiple versions of his 'Sunflowers' paintings. True or False?
Van Gogh’s painting 'La Berceuse' depicts the mother of his nephew. True or False?
Van Gogh sometimes painted at night with candles attached to his hat. True or False?
Van Gogh had absolutely no formal art education whatsoever. True or False?
Van Gogh’s 'Red Vineyard at Arles' is often cited as the only painting he sold in his lifetime. True or False?
Van Gogh’s legacy grew significantly due to the efforts of Johanna van Gogh-Bonger. True or False?
